EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at position (0.0, 0.0):
 – Stone Furnace (position 0.0, 0.0) smelting iron ore and coal; fuel: {'coal': 1}, output inventory: {'iron-plate': 9}.
 – Burner Inserter (position 1.5, 0.5) with pickup at (2.5, 0.5) and drop at (0.5, 0.5).
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at position (5.0, 0.0):
 – Stone Furnace (position 5.0, 0.0) smelting copper ore and coal; fuel: {'coal': 4}, currently with an empty inventory.
 – Feeder Inserter (position 3.5, 0.5) with pickup at (4.5, 0.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5).
• Common Input Chest:
 – Wooden Chest (position 2.5, 0.5) acting as the shared resource provider; current inventory: {'copper-plate': 5}.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill (position -15.0, -50.0) for ore extraction; drop position at (-14.5, -48.5) and status indicating “no fuel.”
• Drill Inserter (position -13.5, -47.5) with pickup at (-12.5, -47.5) and drop at (-14.5, -47.5).
• An intended transport belt connection from the drill output toward the smelting network – connection attempts failed due to target conflicts and incorrect source/target routing.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Placement and Alignment Conflicts:
 – Before placing entities (e.g. input chests or mining drills), verify that the target tile is unoccupied and that spacing parameters are correct.
 – Remove residual or interfering entities to avoid nil references when indexing a local reference.
• Transport Belt Connection Issues:
 – Do not connect transport belts directly to chest prototypes; always use inserters as intermediaries.
 – Ensure that target inserter pickup or drop zones are free of other entities before establishing belt links.
• Inventory and Crafting Oversights:
 – Confirm that required items (for example, burner mining drills) exist in inventory before attempting placement.
• API and Variable Type Handling:
 – Use correct entity prototypes (not strings) when retrieving entities to prevent invalid prototype errors.
 – Ensure variables hold the proper entity type rather than a mere position when calling methods (avoiding attribute errors).

NAMESPACE
─────────
shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity
 • Shifts the given entity’s position locally by the specified offset.
  – Invocation: Successfully defined to resolve prior shift_entity errors.

Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – holds the position of the furnace’s input chest.
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – tracks the current state of the player’s inventory.
